channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Evercore ISI gives Harris/Walz and Trump/Vance stock picks to trade election
item.description: A Harris win could boost clean energy stocks, while a Trump win could benefit financial and energy names, the firm said.

item.title: All stock-market sectors have lost ground Tuesday — except energy and utilities
Israeli forces launch ground offensive in Lebanon as markets fear escalation
item.description: Israel has launched a ground incursion into Lebanese territory, with markets on edge over the escalation in the conflict.

item.title: Iran readying 'imminent' ballistic missile attack against Israel, U.S. official tells NBC News
item.description: Israel launched a ground incursion into Lebanon as part of an attack on Hezbollah, the militant group backed by Iran.

item.title: Apple is sharpest-declining Dow stock as analyst voices iPhone demand concern
The cost of heating your home could soar this winter
item.description: National Energy Assistance Directors Association forecast could make your wallet ache.

item.title: Discover’s CIO says AI in financial services is still in the ‘early stages’ as the industry navigates 2 risks
item.description: Gen AI will eventually be a "very robust enabler" in financial services, says Jason Strle of Discover Financial Services.

item.title: Nike reports earnings after the bell. Here's what Wall Street expects
item.description: Nike is in a reset after critics say it lost sight of innovation and ceded share to competitors. Its CEO John Donahoe is slated to step down this mont...

item.title: Bond ETFs on rise along with tensions in Middle East
GM reports 2.2% decrease in third-quarter sales, but EVs make gains
item.description: The Detroit automaker reported a 2.2% drop in third-quarter sales compared to a year earlier to 659,601 vehicles sold.

item.title: Microsoft exec tells staff there won’t be an Amazon-style return-to-office mandate unless productivity drops
item.description: The software and cloud-computing giant currently allows employees remotely, with many new hires promised the flexibility of working from home at least...

item.title: Tim Walz’s leadership resonates with my country’s Viking Code. Here’s why that matters
